title: Apple Cinnamon Rolls
procedure: 1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C). 2. In a bowl, mix 2 cups of all-purpose flour, 1/4 cup sugar, 1 tsp salt, and 2 tsp yeast. 3. Warm 1/2 cup milk and mix with 1/4 cup melted butter and 1 egg, then combine with the flour to form a dough. 4. Knead for 8-10 minutes until smooth and elastic. 5. Roll the dough into a rectangle, spread 1/4 cup softened butter, sprinkle 1/2 cup brown sugar and 2 tsp cinnamon evenly. 6. Roll the dough tightly and cut into 12 rolls. 7. Place rolls in a greased baking dish, cover, and let rise for 20 minutes. 8. Bake for 25-30 minutes until golden brown. 9. Optional: Drizzle with icing made of powdered sugar and milk.

title: Plantain Fritata
procedure: 1. Peel and slice 1 large ripe plantain into thin rounds. 2. In a skillet, heat 1 tbsp olive oil and lightly fry the plantains until golden, then set aside. 3. In a bowl, whisk 4 eggs, 1/4 cup milk, salt, pepper, and a pinch of nutmeg. 4. Add 1/4 cup diced onions and 1/4 cup bell peppers to the egg mixture. 5. Pour the egg mixture into the skillet over medium heat, then layer the fried plantains on top. 6. Cook uncovered for 5-7 minutes until edges set. 7. Transfer skillet to preheated oven at 350°F (175°C) and bake for 8-10 minutes until the top is firm and golden. 8. Slice and serve warm.

title: Air Frier Hash Browns
procedure: 1. Peel and grate 2 medium potatoes. 2. Place grated potatoes in a clean towel and squeeze out excess water. 3. Transfer potatoes to a bowl, add 1 tsp salt, 1/4 tsp pepper, and 1 tbsp olive oil, then mix well. 4. Preheat air fryer to 400°F (200°C). 5. Form potato mixture into small patties or spread loosely in the basket. 6. Cook for 10-12 minutes, flipping halfway, until golden and crispy. 7. Serve hot with ketchup or your favorite dip.

title: Cinnamon Swirl Bread
procedure: 1. In a large bowl, mix 3 cups flour, 1/4 cup sugar, 1 tsp salt, and 2 tsp yeast. 2. Warm 1 cup milk and combine with 1/4 cup melted butter and 1 egg. 3. Mix wet and dry ingredients until a soft dough forms. 4. Knead for 10 minutes, then let rise in a greased bowl for 30 minutes until doubled. 5. Roll dough into a rectangle, spread 1/4 cup butter, sprinkle 1/2 cup brown sugar and 1 tbsp cinnamon. 6. Roll the dough tightly, tuck ends under, and place in a loaf pan. 7. Cover and let rise 15 minutes. 8. Bake at 350°F (175°C) for 30-35 minutes. 9. Cool before slicing.

title: Mediterranean Dip
procedure: 1. Drain 1 can chickpeas and rinse well. 2. In a food processor, combine chickpeas, 2 tbsp tahini, 2 cloves garlic, 2 tbsp olive oil, juice of 1 lemon, 1/2 tsp salt, 1/4 tsp pepper, and 1/2 tsp cumin. 3. Blend until smooth, adding 1-2 tbsp water for desired consistency. 4. Taste and adjust seasoning. 5. Transfer to a serving bowl, drizzle with olive oil, and sprinkle paprika or chopped parsley. 6. Serve with pita bread, crackers, or raw vegetables.

title: Creamy Soup
procedure: 1. Chop 4 medium tomatoes, 1 onion, and 2 cloves garlic. 2. Heat 1 tbsp olive oil in a saucepan, sauté onion and garlic until soft. 3. Add tomatoes and 2 cups vegetable broth. 4. Simmer for 20 minutes until tomatoes are tender. 5. Blend the mixture until smooth using a hand blender. 6. Return to heat, stir in 1/2 cup heavy cream, salt, pepper, and herbs (basil or thyme). 7. Simmer 5 more minutes, then serve hot.

title: Fluffy Pancakes
procedure: 1. In a bowl, whisk 1 1/2 cups flour, 3 1/2 tsp baking powder, 1 tsp salt, and 1 tbsp sugar. 2. In another bowl, beat 1 egg with 1 1/4 cups milk and 3 tbsp melted butter. 3. Pour wet ingredients into dry and stir gently until just combined; lumps are okay. 4. Preheat a non-stick skillet over medium heat, lightly grease with butter. 5. Pour 1/4 cup batter per pancake, cook until bubbles form, then flip and cook 1-2 minutes more. 6. Serve stacked with syrup or fruits.

title: Fruit Smoothie
procedure: 1. Chop 1 banana, 1 cup berries, and 1/2 cup mango. 2. Place fruits in blender with 1/2 cup yogurt and 1/2 cup milk. 3. Add 1 tsp honey or sweetener if desired. 4. Blend until smooth. 5. Pour into glasses, garnish with fresh fruit slices or mint leaves, and serve immediately.

title: Avocado Toast
procedure: 1. Toast 2 slices of bread until golden. 2. Mash 1 ripe avocado in a bowl with a fork. 3. Add salt, pepper, and a squeeze of lemon juice to avocado. 4. Spread avocado evenly on toast. 5. Optional toppings: sliced tomatoes, radishes, or poached egg. 6. Serve immediately.

title: Classic Waffles
procedure: 1. Preheat waffle iron. 2. In a bowl, whisk 2 cups flour, 2 tbsp sugar, 1 tbsp baking powder, 1/2 tsp salt. 3. In another bowl, mix 2 eggs, 1 3/4 cups milk, 1/2 cup melted butter, and 1 tsp vanilla. 4. Combine wet and dry ingredients gently; do not overmix. 5. Pour batter into waffle iron and cook until golden brown. 6. Serve with syrup, fruits, or whipped cream.

title: Granola Bowl
procedure: 1. In a bowl, combine 1 cup granola, 1/2 cup yogurt, 1/2 cup milk. 2. Slice fruits like banana, berries, and apple. 3. Layer granola, yogurt, and fruits in serving bowls. 4. Drizzle with honey and sprinkle nuts or seeds. 5. Serve immediately.

title: Bagel Sandwich
procedure: 1. Slice bagel in half and toast until golden. 2. Spread cream cheese on both halves. 3. Layer with lettuce, tomato slices, and cooked eggs or turkey. 4. Season with salt, pepper, or herbs. 5. Close sandwich and slice in half. 6. Serve immediately.

title: French Toast
procedure: 1. In a shallow bowl, whisk 2 eggs, 1/2 cup milk, 1 tsp vanilla extract, and 1/2 tsp cinnamon. 2. Dip 4 slices of bread in the egg mixture, coating both sides. 3. Heat 1 tbsp butter in a skillet over medium heat. 4. Cook bread slices 2-3 minutes per side until golden brown. 5. Serve with syrup, powdered sugar, or fresh fruits.
